content: The "Save the Children Act of 2016" may be cited as the short title. Congress expresses a sense regarding the act. Congress acknowledges the humanitarian crisis faced by Syrian children due to civil war violence, their displacement to refugee camps, and the willingness of US citizens and organizations to provide temporary support. (2) United States citizens, NGOs, and state governments are willing to support young child refugees from Syria during the ongoing crisis; (3) Efforts should be made by key government officials to relocate and care for up to 25,000 young Syrian minor children refugees who are orphaned or lack proper guardians. The Secretary of State, Attorney General, Secretary of Homeland Security, and Secretary of Health and Human Services should facilitate the relocation and care of up to 25,000 young Syrian minor children refugees who are orphaned or lack proper guardians into the United States over three years. The Act aims to transfer custody of Syrian child refugees to the United States over three years and facilitate family reunification or safe relocation back to Syria after a reduction in civil war violence and displaced inhabitants.
